Message.Title: Price matching by Retailerz guarantee that AMZN will never have decent earningz
Message.Msg: The recent and price matching guarantee by retailerz like Target ensurez that AMZN businezz model of revenue growth is coming to an end. Who waitz for 2 dayz or more and be afraid of conterfietz, damaged goodz, and return shipping, when you can go to your local Target or Wallmart or Best Buy and get the product for the same price. Once the state tax advantage is gone, people will not buy much from AMZN at all. They are trailing the competition in almost everything else they do ( including kindle, streaming moviez. etc. etc..). The Institutions holding this PIG already realized that. That is why all analystz are coming out and upgrading it, to pump it up so that the poor retail pumperz buy it while they unload. The beginning if the end if very near. And the earningz coming up will show you that. - Aye Pumperz

Message.Title: Lets Compare Notes--Bulls & Bears, what price levels would get you concerned?
Message.Msg: I would get concerned if volume on the rallies started to increase. So far, low volume has not confirmed the rally. As far as price goes, If AMZN exceeded $300 on better than expected earnings/revenues (unlikely imo), that might indicate a blowout top in the $320-340 area. But the volume would have to confirm. I still believe the most likely scenario is a significant pullback (20%?) after earnings on Jan 29, since I'm 90% certain they will be less then consensus. Ultimately, a retest of the $205 area. If earnings and revenues exceed estimates seems very unlikely given the macroeconomic picture--weak retail sales + sales taxes.

Topic.Title: Chance of a Chipotle-style stock collapse after earnings--62.543%

Message.Msg: Where should i start??? 1) have you seen their esp result from the past year??? q4 2011 eps = 0.38, q1 2012 eps = 0.28, q2 eps = 0.01, and q3 2012 eps = -.6 (a loss of $0.60 per share)... do you notice a trend??? 2) it has widely been reported that holiday sales have disappointed. Comscore reported you growth of 14%... amzn is suppose to do 27% 3) sales tax has was collected in ca, pa an tx (very large markets) and there are reports that sales have lagged other states. 4) the average rev per unit sold is trending down, while shipping costs are flat to up. this pressures margins. 5) they cut prices on aws (their cloud services) by 25%. I don't see how they hit an eps of 0.27. Even if they do, they will have negative earnings for the year!!!

Message.Title: AMZN Guidance
Message.Msg: AMZN gave the following guidance for q4 2012: Rev - 20.25 to 22.75 billion (wall street is expecting 22.28 billion) Income between negative 480 million to position 310 million (I'm a bit surprised at the large range). That equates to a loss of 1.06 per share to a profit of 0.68 per share. The street expects a profit of 0.27 (good luck with that). Note they lost 0.60 per share.

Topic.Title: AMZN Guidance

Message.Msg: AMZN is expected to beat both in revenues and earnings for Q4 2012. Traditionally, that has been their strongest quarter - Christmas shopping was strong.

Topic.Title: AMZN Guidance

Message.Msg: That ain't nothin' but smoke and flippin' mirrors. Stay true to your convictions. -mc

Topic.Title: AMZN Guidance

Message.Msg: Seeing how they missed eps estimates the last two quarters, i wouldn't be too surprised if they missed again. Here's a list why they will miss eps imo: 1) have you seen their esp result from the past year??? q4 2011 eps = 0.38, q1 2012 eps = 0.28, q2 eps = 0.01, and q3 2012 eps = -.6 (a loss of $0.60 per share)... do you notice a trend??? 2) it has widely been reported that holiday sales have disappointed. Comscore reported yoy online sales growth of 14%... amzn is suppose to do 27% 3) sales tax was collected in ca, pa an tx (very large markets) and there are reports that sales have lagged other states. 4) the average rev per unit sold is trending down, while shipping costs are flat to up. this pressures margins. 5) they cut prices on aws (their cloud services) by 25%. I don't see how they hit an eps of 0.27. Even if they do, they will have negative earnings for the year!!!

Message.Title: before she quit the SEC, sheila said:
Message.Msg: Here’s how former FDIC chief Sheila Bair summed it up in an interview with Reuters 2 weeks ago. Her comments were made in reference to, what she called, “The Mother of all bond bubbles”. BAIR: “Fundamentals do not support current current Treasurys prices…This is what we saw in the housing bubble, a massive underpricing of risk. Eventually, it’s going to correct, and that’s going to create long-term problems for our kids and our country as well as short-term problems for the financial sector” As sybil haz repeatedly stated: Unwinding the Fed’s bulging balance sheet is not going to be easy or painfree ($3 trillion worth of bond debt) There’s a good chance that yields on USTs will skyrocket while the hobbled dollar goes into freefall. As economist Michael Hudson likes to say, “There’s no free lunch.” This what we face when the fed triez out for the olympic dive team: TARP, TALF, QE1, QE2, Operation Twist, QE 3, to QE monthly for "an extended period of time". Who iz this, Rodney Dangerfield with the Triple Lindee?

Message.Title: This was written in mid 2012, 1/2 a year before geitner quit...
Message.Msg: This will happen with the U.S. Treasury bond market, as such low rates will attract fewer and fewer buyers. When the Treasury bubble eventually pops - as Warren Buffett and others have predicted - that's when the stock market will tank. Higher interest rates will have to be paid, which will lure investment capital away from stocks and into bonds. In a recent interview with The Wall Street Journal, former Secretary of the Treasury and Secretary of State George Schultz noted that, "It's startling that in the last year, three-quarters of the debt that's been issued has been bought by the Fed and the balance has been bought by other countries, so U.S. citizens and institutions are not on net buying U.S. debt...The Fed doesn't have an unlimited capacity because when it buys the debt what it's doing is monetizing the debt. Sooner or later that has to get out into the economy. Can't be held forever." That's why you need to prepare for a stock market crash in 2013. Soooo whu do you think geitner quit? Perhaps to spend more time with hiz family? He'z only in hiz mid fortiez... Whats up tim?
